event: Earliest human presence in present-day Guatemala
Early Maya communities develop agriculture and villages
Classic Maya civilization flourishes with major city-states
Collapse of Classic Maya lowland cities
Postclassic Maya kingdoms dominate the highlands
Spanish conquest of Maya kingdoms begins
Capital of the Captaincy General of Guatemala is established
Colonial society consolidates around highland cities
Destructive earthquakes lead to relocation of the capital
Joins the Federal Republic of Central America
Liberal reforms expand coffee production and land concentration
Civil war begins between state and insurgent groups
Peace accords end decades-long civil war
